Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-grey pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is pink in section, the interior is encrusted with a brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink (?).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394152) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394152)
